page.title: 05Pembrey Church
page.content: Pembrey has a beautiful{twelfth {century Norman church}in the centre of the village. The church is in a superb state of preseveration thanks to the skill and crafstmanship of diligent workmen throughout the ages.The tower is approximately 70ft high, 25ft square at the base and 23ft square at the top.There is a sundial above the porch door. Inside the church is a{Hagioscope}or Squint. On the arch of the South-East window in the knave are 8{Hatchments}. They probably represent the arms of deceased Lords of the Manor. Attatched to the outside of the South-West wall is a{Ffald}or{Pound,} formerly used to impound stray cattle. This is now one of the best preserved in Wales.
